message.content: This question requires knowledge about the relationship between skidding and friction. Skidding is the result of reduced friction between the object (e.g. car, bike) and the surface it is moving on. Option (C) is correct because in Nascar races, cars often skid on the track due to the high speeds and turns, which creates friction between the tires and the pavement. Options (A), (B), and (D) are incorrect because they do not directly involve skidding or the relationship between skidding and friction.
